Metadata: Expression and assembly of a fully active antibody in algae
"Proceedings of the National Academy of Science," 100(2):438-442, 2003.

In this work, scientists show that human monoclonal antibodies can be expressed in transgenic algae chloroplasts. They engineered a large single-chain antibody in the chloroplast of the unicellular green alga "Chlamydomonas reinhardtii". This antibody is directed against herpes simplex virus glycoprotein D. The antibody accumulates as a soluble protein in transgenic chloroplants and binds herpes virus proteins as determined by ELISA assays.
